2015.context: CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. is a cloud-native cybersecurity company focused on endpoint protection, threat intelligence, and extended detection and response. Cloud-native endpoint protection. Falcon platform launched.

competitors.notes: Microsoft Defender evolving endpoint protection solutions

competitors.name: Bitdefender

competitors.name: Trend Micro

competitors.name: Sophos

2024.context: CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. is a cloud-native cybersecurity company focused on endpoint protection, threat intelligence, and extended detection and response. Global IT outage in July. Recovery and platform expansion continuing.

competitors.name: SentinelOne Singularity
competitors.notes: Strong replacement with similar EDR performance at lower pricing. 10% market share. Stock rose 10% after July 2024 CrowdStrike outage.

competitors.name: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
competitors.notes: Strong choice for Microsoft-invested businesses. Part of Microsoft 365 E5 package. 11.82% market share.

competitors.name: Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR
competitors.notes: One of world's best detection and response providers. Stock rose 10% after July 2024 CrowdStrike outage.

competitors.name: McAfee ePO
competitors.notes: Leading competitor with 15.73% market share in endpoint protection.

competitors.name: Sophos
competitors.notes: Focuses on mid-sized organizations. Strong position in SMB market.

competitors.name: Trend Micro Vision One
competitors.notes: Unified security platform for all business sizes.

competitors.name: Trellix
competitors.notes: Endpoint security competitor (merger of McAfee Enterprise and FireEye).

competitors.name: VMware Carbon Black Endpoint
competitors.notes: Cloud-native endpoint protection with EDR capabilities.

competitors.name: Fortinet
competitors.notes: Cybersecurity competitor in endpoint protection.

competitors.name: Cynet 360 AutoXDR Protector
competitors.notes: XDR platform competitor.

competitors.name: Darktrace
competitors.notes: AI-driven cybersecurity competitor.

2025.context: CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. is a cloud-native cybersecurity company focused on endpoint protection, threat intelligence, and extended detection and response. Leading XDR platform. Cloud and identity security expansion.

competitors.name: SentinelOne
competitors.notes: Third-largest competitor with 10.00% market share. AI-powered cybersecurity platform delivering protection for endpoints, cloud workloads, and IoT devices. Founded in 2013, offers real-time threat detection, automated responses, and comprehensive security management. Named a Leader in 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Endpoint Protection Platforms for five years running.

competitors.name: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
competitors.notes: Second-largest competitor with 11.82% market share. Endpoint security solution including EDR, ASR, email security across iOS, IoT, Android, Linux, macOS, and Windows devices. Best suited for Microsoft-heavy technology stacks with strong integration into Microsoft ecosystem.

competitors.name: McAfee ePO
competitors.notes: Largest competitor by market share at 15.73%. Comprehensive enterprise endpoint protection platform with extensive management capabilities and broad feature set for large organizations.

competitors.name: Cynet
competitors.notes: Rated as best overall CrowdStrike alternative. All-in-One Cybersecurity Platform with more budget-friendly pricing structure, particularly for small and medium-sized organizations. Offers straightforward deployment process for businesses without large IT departments.

competitors.name: Bitdefender GravityZone
competitors.notes: Cybersecurity platform for individual consumers, small businesses, enterprises, and MSPs. Enhanced attack protection utilizing system hardening, threat prevention and detection, machine learning, and behavioral analysis. Key features include endpoint protection, sandbox analyzer, network attack defense, cloud security analytics, and patch management.

competitors.name: Carbon Black (Broadcom)
competitors.notes: Cloud-native security platform focused on endpoint security. Originally from VMware, became a Broadcom security offering following Broadcom's acquisition of VMware. Competes with cloud-native EDR capabilities.

competitors.name: Trend Micro Vision One
competitors.notes: Unified cybersecurity platform combining EDR with extended detection and response capabilities and telemetry across enterprise email, cloud, and networks. Good for holistic visibility beyond just endpoint-centric focus.

competitors.name: Huntress
competitors.notes: Leading EPP solution in 2025 alongside CrowdStrike, SentinelOne, and Cynet. Caters to different needs from large enterprises to SMBs with AI-powered detection and automated remediation.

mentionedBy.name: Palo Alto Networks Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Cloud-native competitor focusing on cloud security, identity protection, and AI-driven tools. CEO George Kurtz emphasizes maintaining competitive edge in these areas. Represents a significant threat from cloud-native players challenging traditional approaches.

mentionedBy.name: Qualys Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Provides Falcon Spotlight for vulnerability management as part of broader security platform. Endpoint-focused VM built directly into EDR for real-time exposure views and patch status.

mentionedBy.name: Rapid7 Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Leading cloud-native endpoint protection with AI threat detection

mentionedBy.name: Rapid7 Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Leader in endpoint security with advanced threat detection

mentionedBy.name: SentinelOne Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Emerging cloud-native endpoint protection

mentionedBy.name: SentinelOne Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Primary competitor, leader in cloud-native endpoint protection

mentionedBy.name: SentinelOne Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Best overall alternative, cloud-native architecture, comprehensive endpoint protection, threat intelligence, 24/7 threat hunting, better threat intelligence but higher price point

mentionedBy.name: SentinelOne Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Renowned for cloud-native architecture with comprehensive endpoint protection, threat intelligence, and 24/7 threat hunting. Falcon XDR synthesizes multi-domain telemetry into attack insights from a single platform. Sets apart with mature EDR foundation - protecting endpoints longer than most competitors have existed. Higher price point but strong ease of setup and usability.

mentionedBy.name: Tenable Holdings Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Major cybersecurity platform with endpoint protection

mentionedBy.name: Tenable Holdings Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Main competitor when buyers want VM built directly into EDR instead of separate scanner. Endpoint-focused VM module on Falcon agent providing real-time exposure views and patch status. Plugs into broader Falcon Exposure Management/RBVM stack with ExPRT.AI.
